comments: Let p be a prime. Then the n-th number with p divisors is equal to prime(n)^(p-1). - _Omar E. Pol_, May 06 2008Solutions of the equation n'=10*n^(9/10), where n' is the arithmetic derivative of n. - _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 31 2012
links: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
OEIS Wiki, Index entries for number of divisors
formula: a(n) =A000040(n)^10, i.e. tenth power of n-th prime. - _Henry Bottomley_, Aug 20 2001
prog: (Sage) BB = primes_first_n(36) list = [] for i in range(36): list.append(BB[i]^10) list # _Zerinvary Lajos_, May 16 2007(MAGMA) [p^10: p in PrimesUpTo(300)]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Mar 27 2014
author: _Jeff Burch_
